Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Scenario \Sce*na"ri*o\, n. [It.] A preliminary sketch of the plot, or main incidents, of an opera. [1913 Webster]

scenario n 1: an outline or synopsis of a play (or, by extension, of a literary work) 2: a setting for a work of art or literature; "the scenario is France during the Reign of Terror" 3: a postulated sequence of possible events; "planners developed several scenarios in case of an attack"
